page.title: 15TRAFFIC FLOW,ALLER & LOW HAM
page.content: Traffic was monitored in 2 places: on the A372 in the village of {Aller,}and in the centre of the hamlet of{Low Ham The survey was taken at 11.00am for 1 hour. The following trends emerged: {Low Ham:}10 cars, 6 commercial vehicles and 3 tractors pass through the hamlet in a typical hour. Several cars and tractors tow trailers. {Aller:}150 cars, 20 commercial vehicles, 4 tractors, 1 bus or coach and a few bicycles and motorcycles used the road during this hour. Many cars are used by holiday-makers in the summer season, often towing caravans. Several foreign cars (French Spanish, German) were spotted. There are no speed limits in High Ham, Henley, Low Ham or Beer, but there is a 30 m.p.h. speed limit in Aller.
